title: Wisdom and Genius - true voice of the passage

content.question: Which of the following is true of the voice of the passage?

choices.label: It becomes strident when the speaker anticipates or refutes objections.
It shifts from colloquial to formal expression.
It reveals the speaker's cautiousness about making assertions and generalizations.
It conveys a sense of confidence and authority.

content.answer: It conveys a sense of confidence and authority.

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Explain how word choice, comparisons, and syntax contribute to the specific tone or style of a text.
